intro: Uragoga wildemanii, commonly known as the wildemanii uragoga, is a rare and lesser-known plant species native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is characterized by its unique floral structures. The plant typically features hairy, broad leaves and produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers in shades of pink and white. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Uragoga wildemanii is considered a vulnerable species.
